name: Catholic Charities Atlanta
address: Multiple locations throughout Atlanta, GA. (Specific addresses vary by program and service.)
description: Offers career services, including resume workshops, interview techniques, and soft skills training. They also have a Leadership Class focused on spiritual and professional growth for young adults
services: Catholic-owned Professional development in Georgia consultation

name: Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Atlanta
address: 2401 Lake Park Dr. SE, Smyrna, GA 30080
description: Provides various professional development resources, including videos on writing skills, stress management, team building, communication, and listening skills. They also offer an Intercultural Competency Course
services: Catholic-owned Professional development in Georgia consultation

name: Catholic Leadership Institute (CLI)
address: While based in Pennsylvania, CLI collaborates with the Archdiocese of Atlanta and parishes in Georgia
description: Offers pastoral leadership formation and consulting services to bishops, priests, religious, deacons, and lay persons in the Roman Catholic Church. They collaborate with dioceses and parishes to strengthen leadership
services: Catholic-owned Professional development in Georgia consultation

name: St. Vincent de Paul Georgia (SVDP Georgia)
address: Conference Support Center, 2050-C Chamblee Tucker Road, Atlanta, GA 30341
description: Offers "Workforce Wednesday" job fairs and resources for career development, training, and education programs. They also provide adult life skills classes and financial education workshops
services: Catholic-owned Professional development in Georgia consultation

name: Ignatius House Jesuit Retreat Center
address: 650 Cramer's Creek Rd, Atlanta, GA 30327 (Note: This is a retreat center, but offers formation programs.)
description: While primarily a retreat center rooted in Ignatian spirituality, they offer formation programs such as the "Tending the Flame" Spiritual Direction Formation Program, which involves training in spiritual direction grounded in the Ignatian tradition
services: Catholic-owned Professional development in Georgia consultation

name: Jesuit Volunteer Corps (JVC)
address: JVC operates nationwide, with volunteers placed in various locations. Specific Georgia placements may vary
description: JVC places young adults in service roles that foster personal and professional development, living in community and working for social justice. While not a direct professional development provider in the traditional sense, the experience offers significant growth and skill-building
services: Catholic-owned Professional development in Georgia consultation

name: Young Catholic Professionals (YCP) Atlanta
address: Events are held at various locations in Atlanta
description: YCP connects young adults (20s and 30s) for fellowship, networking, inspiration, and spiritual connection in their professional careers. They host events and offer opportunities to learn from experienced Catholics
services: Catholic-owned Professional development in Georgia consultation

name: Mercy Care
description: Mercy Care offers clinical volunteer opportunities that allow individuals to expand their professional skills. They also provide training related to vocational rehabilitation and member engagement for employment
services: Catholic-owned Professional development in Georgia consultation

name: Christ The King Jesuit College Preparatory School
address: While located in Chicago, IL, the school's Corporate Work Study Program (CWSP) involves professional development for students and partnerships with businesses, which could be relevant for understanding professional development models
description: This school focuses on integrating academics, work experience, and extracurricular activities for students, offering professional development through its Corporate Work Study Program
services: Catholic-owned Professional development in Georgia consultation

name: Catholic Charities USA
address: National organization with local agencies across the U.S., including Georgia
description: Catholic Charities USA offers various workforce development programs, including pre-apprenticeship and apprenticeship programs, adult basic education, GED, ESOL, and employment readiness
